intro: Phoebe sterculioides, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing smooth, oval seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
